episodeTitle: To Live Up to a Promise! Luffy and Coby Collide!
description: Luffy, restored by Ivankov's hormones, charges toward the execution platform. Koby confronts him to uphold their promise, but is quickly defeated. As Whitebeard's commanders fall to the Admirals, Luffy unleashes an unconscious burst of Conqueror's Haki, stunning the executioners and shocking everyone present.

events.title: Ivankov Warns Luffy About Hormone Side Effects
events.description: Emporio Ivankov warns Luffy that the Tension Hormones he injected only trick his body into feeling energized but do not repair the actual damage he has sustained. Despite this warning, Luffy insists he will not fall again.
events.significance: Establishes the dangerous toll Luffy is taking on his body and his unwavering determination to save Ace regardless of the consequences to himself.

quotes.text: The energy hormones do not repair the damage you have taken!
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Warning Luffy about the temporary nature of the hormone boost

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's determination to continue despite his injuries

events.title: Luffy Defeats Multiple Marines
events.description: Luffy easily disperses a multitude of marines who attempt to block his path to the execution platform, demonstrating his restored strength from the hormone injection.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's temporary recovery and determination as he pushes forward to save Ace.

events.title: Koby Remembers His Promise with Luffy
events.description: Koby recalls the moment he first met Luffy and the promises they made to each other - Luffy to become Pirate King and Koby to become a Marine Admiral. This flashback strengthens Koby's resolve to face Luffy.
events.significance: Highlights the parallel journeys of Luffy and Koby since Episode 1, showing how both have grown stronger pursuing their dreams. It adds emotional weight to their confrontation.

quotes.text: I made a promise... to become a great Marine!
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby remembering his dream as he prepares to face Luffy

events.title: Luffy Defeats Koby with Gomu Gomu no Bullet
events.description: Koby steps forward to fight Luffy in memory of their promise, hoping to stop him from advancing. However, Luffy easily defeats him with a single Gomu Gomu no Bullet attack, knocking Koby unconscious.
events.significance: Demonstrates the vast difference in power between Luffy and Koby at this point in the story, while also showing Luffy's single-minded focus on saving Ace. It's a bittersweet moment showing how far Luffy has come.

events.title: Pacifistas Attack Luffy and Ivankov
events.description: As Luffy and Ivankov continue their advance, they are confronted and stopped by multiple Pacifista units who prepare to eliminate them.
events.significance: Creates a seemingly insurmountable obstacle for Luffy as the powerful Pacifistas block his path to Ace.

events.title: Boa Hancock Destroys Pacifista
events.description: Boa Hancock intervenes to protect Luffy and Ivankov. The Pacifistas initially recognize her as an ally and hesitate, but when they order her to step aside, she destroys one of them in anger, refusing to let them speak her name.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hancock's immense power and her willingness to betray the Marines for Luffy's sake. Shows her evolution from Warlord to Luffy's ally.

quotes.text: I do not want the likes of you to say my name!
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock's declaration before destroying the Pacifista

events.title: Whitebeard Overwhelmed by Akainu and Marines
events.description: A weakened Whitebeard, already suffering from his injuries and illness, is further impaired by Admiral Akainu. Multiple marines swarm and attack him relentlessly, taking advantage of his deteriorating condition.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Whitebeard's final stand. This moment shows the toll the war has taken on the World's Strongest Man and sets up his eventual fate.

events.title: Marco Restrained by Kizaru with Seastone
events.description: Marco attempts to help Whitebeard but is intercepted by Admiral Kizaru. Vice Admiral Onigumo places seastone handcuffs on Marco, nullifying his Phoenix Devil Fruit powers and allowing Kizaru to brutally damage him.
events.significance: The capture of Marco, Whitebeard's right-hand man, is a devastating blow to the Whitebeard Pirates. It shows the Marines' strategic planning and leaves Whitebeard without his strongest commanders.

events.title: Jozu Frozen by Aokiji
events.description: Jozu, the third division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates, is frozen solid by Admiral Aokiji's ice powers, completely immobilizing him and removing him from the battle.
events.significance: With both Marco and Jozu defeated, the Whitebeard Pirates lose two of their strongest fighters, drastically shifting the balance of power in the Marines' favor.

events.title: Sengoku Orders Ace's Execution to Proceed
events.description: With new executioners in place, Fleet Admiral Sengoku orders them to execute Portgas D. Ace immediately, as Luffy continues his desperate advance toward the platform.
events.significance: Creates the ultimate moment of tension as Ace's execution is seconds away from being carried out, raising the stakes to their absolute peak.

events.title: Luffy's Conqueror's Haki Awakens
events.description: As the executioners raise their blades to kill Ace, Luffy unleashes an unconscious burst of Conqueror's Haki (Haoshoku Haki). The sheer force of his willpower knocks out both executioners, numerous Marines, and even some pirates, stopping Ace's execution at the last possible moment.
events.significance: This is the first clear manifestation of Luffy's Conqueror's Haki, one of the rarest and most powerful abilities in One Piece. It confirms Luffy possesses the qualities of a king and marks him as someone with immense potential. This moment stuns all three Admirals and confirms to the world that Luffy is an extreme threat.

events.title: The Admirals and Pirates React to Luffy's Haki
events.description: Everyone at Marineford reacts with shock to Luffy's Conqueror's Haki. The three Admirals comment on the tremendous power. Garp states that Luffy was born with it, as he suspected. Ace recognizes it saying 'he uses it too.' Ivankov notes that Luffy is using it unconsciously and is not yet ready to control it.
events.significance: The reactions from the most powerful people in the world confirm the rarity and importance of Conqueror's Haki. It establishes that very few people possess this power and that Luffy is among them.

quotes.text: He was born with it... just as I thought.
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Garp
quotes.context: Garp's reaction to Luffy's Conqueror's Haki

quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Ace
quotes.context: Ace recognizing that Luffy has Conqueror's Haki

quotes.context: Ivankov commenting on Luffy's unconscious use of Haki

themes.description: Luffy pushes his body beyond its limits, accepting potentially fatal consequences to save his brother Ace. Despite warnings about the hormones' effects, he refuses to give up.
themes.symbolism: The hormone boost represents Luffy's willingness to sacrifice his own health and future for those he loves.

themes.description: The episode culminates in Luffy's unconscious burst of Conqueror's Haki, demonstrating that sheer willpower can overcome impossible odds.
themes.symbolism: Conqueror's Haki symbolizes the strength of one's conviction and the ability to impose one's will on reality itself.

themes.description: The confrontation between Luffy and Koby shows how far both have come since Episode 1, each pursuing their respective dreams despite being on opposite sides.
themes.symbolism: Their clash represents the collision of their ideals - piracy versus justice - while their mutual respect remains intact.

themes.description: Multiple characters demonstrate extreme loyalty - Hancock betraying the Marines for Luffy, the Whitebeard commanders fighting to their limits, and Luffy risking everything for Ace.
themes.symbolism: The bonds between characters prove stronger than alliances, positions, or even self-preservation.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy unknowingly awakens his Conqueror's Haki in a moment of absolute desperation, revealing his potential as a true king among men.
keyActions: Accepts Ivankov's warning about the hormones but continues anyway
Defeats Koby with Gomu Gomu no Bullet
Stops Ace's execution with his willpower alone

characterSpotlights.development: Koby demonstrates his growth by bravely confronting Luffy, though he realizes he still has far to go to match his friend's strength.
keyActions: Remembers his promise to become a great Marine
Confronts Luffy despite knowing he will lose
Gets defeated but maintains his resolve
quotes: I made a promise... to become a great Marine!

characterSpotlights.development: Hancock fully commits to helping Luffy, even destroying Marines' weapons (Pacifistas) and betraying her position as a Warlord.
keyActions: Openly defies the World Government for Luffy's sake
quotes: I do not want the likes of you to say my name!

characterSpotlights.role: Wounded warrior making his last stand
characterSpotlights.development: Whitebeard continues to fight despite severe injuries, showing the indomitable spirit that made him a legend.
keyActions: Watches helplessly as his commanders are defeated

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime does not show Jango fainting from Luffy's Conqueror's Haki, while the manga depicted this.
The anime extends the battle sequences and reactions to Luffy's Haki for dramatic effect, while the manga moves through these moments more quickly.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 569 (pages 2-15) titled 'White Monster' from the manga.
Episode 478 aired with a TV rating of 10.7%, ranking 4th in its time slot.
This is the first clear manifestation of Luffy's Conqueror's Haki in the anime, though he had previously used it unknowingly against Duval's bull Motobaro in Episode 389.
Kinryu Arimoto, the Japanese voice actor for Whitebeard, passed away on February 1, 2019, at age 78 after suffering from esophageal cancer.
The opening song 'One day' by The ROOTLESS is noted for being more somber in tone compared to previous One Piece openings, reflecting the gravity of the Marineford Arc events.
The eyecatcher for this episode features Luffy and Brook.
